definition: sb with preternaturally good hearing (in fiction)/fig. a well-informed person
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: This stour describes two characters from journey to the West.
sentences.chinese: 千里眼和顺风耳是《西游记》中的两个人物。

sentences.english: Latest internet news, webmaster of the eyes and ears.
sentences.chinese: 互联网最新动态新闻，站长的千里眼和顺风耳。

sentences.english: They are "the eyes and ears" of the higher commanders.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是上级首长的“千里眼，顺风耳”。

sentences.english: I've always said you have ears which reach around corners.
sentences.chinese: 我总是说你有一双顺风耳。

sentences.english: The monitors must be forward ears and eyes to the top leaders.
sentences.chinese: 技术侦察兵必须成为高级首长的千里眼顺风耳。

definition: to possess great magical power/to possess remarkable abilities
predictable/sth one can predict without being a clairvoyant
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
to prophesy with supernatural accuracy (idiom)/to have an incredible foresight
lit. the eyes watch six roads and the ears listen in all directions/to be observant and alert (idiom)
pinyin: yan3 guan1 liu4 lu4 er3 ting1 ba1 fang1

definition: eyes and ears/sb's attention or notice/information/knowledge/spies
lit. to go up to heaven or down to Hades (idiom)/fig. to go to great lengths/to search heaven and earth
